title: The Three Levers of Nutrition
content: The framework to explain eating is based on modifying three parameters or “pulling 3 levers” in various combinations: what you eat or don’t eat (i.e., dietary restriction or DR), how much you eat (i.e., caloric restriction or CR), or when you eat and don’t eat (i.e., time restriction or TR).

title: Time Restriction
content: Time restriction (TR) possibly contains the simplest dietary prescription: limit your eating to a window of X hours. For example, “Only eat between noon and 8 pm each day.” Most people are already doing something like a 10/14 TRF schedule, even without a modicum of effort (i.e., not eating for 10 hours; eating within a 14-hour window).

title: Benefits of Time Restriction
content: The metabolic flexibility experienced with TRF is certainly on par with what is experienced during a longer journey in nutritional ketosis. For example, though eating only one (large) meal per day at dinner, one can work up to doing a 6-hour very tough bike ride on nothing but water in the first half of the day.

title: The Standard American Diet
content: If you want to be sick, don’t do any of these things. Eat as much as you want (no CR), of anything you want (no DR), whenever you want (no TR). This is called the “standard American diet.”
